qas.question: What was the last British colony remaining in Africa?
When was the second-to-last British colony in Africa granted independence?
When was the Unilateral Declaration of Independence of Rhodesia?
What new country did the Lancaster House Agreement recognize?
Where was the Mau Mau Uprising?

context: Britain's remaining colonies in Africa, except for self-governing <a0_0>Southern Rhodesia<a0_0/>, were all granted independence by <a1_0>1968<a1_0/>. British withdrawal from the southern and eastern parts of Africa was not a peaceful process. <a4_0>Kenyan<a4_0/> independence was preceded by the eight-year <a3_0>Mau Mau Uprising<a3_0/>. In Rhodesia, the <a2_0>1965<a2_0/> Unilateral Declaration of Independence by the white minority resulted in a civil war that lasted until the Lancaster House Agreement of 1979, which set the terms for recognised independence in 1980, as the new nation of Zimbabwe.
